commits.subject: fix(interest-form): align with external API contract
commits.body:
Two mismatches with the API's expected payload:

1. _honeypot field: The frontend did a client-side check but never sent
   the field to the server. Now sends _honeypot: '' in every request so
   bots bypassing frontend JS still get caught by the server's 400.

2. message field: Frontend marked it as "(optional)" but the API requires
   it. Now required with HTML validation. Test updated to match — empty
   message is rejected.

Tags: api-contract, bugfix, forms
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: portfolio-polish
Semver: patch

commits.title: align with external API contract

commits.subject: fix(interest-form): detect API-not-deployed and show actionable errors
commits.body:
Root cause: Vercel logs show all requests to /api/send-interest return
404 — the API serverless functions are not deployed. Vercel serves 404
without CORS headers, so the browser throws "TypeError: Failed to fetch"
which is indistinguishable from a network failure on mobile Chrome.

Three changes:

1. DebugBanner diagnostics: Add "API Deployed" check that hits the
   /api/health endpoint before checking CORS. When health returns 404,
   the diagnostic clearly shows "API not deployed — redeploy with:
   cd api && npx vercel --prod". CORS check is skipped when not deployed
   to avoid a confusing secondary failure.

2. InterestForm error handling: Replace single CORS probe with
   three-phase diagnoseFailure() that distinguishes not-deployed (health
   endpoint 404), CORS misconfigured (health OK but form fetch blocked),
   and network failure (server unreachable). Each gets a specific
   user-facing message.

3. api/vercel.json: Remove legacy "builds" configuration in favor of
   Vercel zero-config auto-detection. The legacy format can cause
   deployment issues and is no longer needed for the api/ directory
   structure.

Tags: vercel, deployment, debug, cors, error-handling
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 4
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: interest-form
Semver: patch

https://claude.ai/code/session_018JkxSHN3SsV57HYmUB2kSs
commits.title: detect API-not-deployed and show actionable errors

commits.subject: fix(interest-form): resolve mobile Chrome CORS/SW fetch failures
commits.body:
Three changes to fix "Failed to fetch" TypeErrors on mobile Chrome:

1. Add explicit NetworkOnly runtimeCaching strategy for Vercel API
   endpoints in the service worker config. The navigateFallbackDenylist
   only controls navigation fallback — it does not prevent the SW fetch
   handler from intercepting cross-origin requests, which can break
   CORS preflight on some mobile Chrome versions.

2. Add CORS-aware error detection in InterestForm: after all fetch
   attempts fail with TypeError, a mode:'no-cors' probe differentiates
   "server unreachable" from "CORS misconfigured", giving users a more
   actionable error message instead of the generic network error.

3. Split DebugBanner "API Reachable" diagnostic into two checks:
   a no-cors reachability probe and a cors OPTIONS request. This
   separates network failures from CORS misconfigurations in the
   diagnostics panel, making future debugging clearer.

Tags: pwa, cors, mobile, service-worker, debug
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: paid
Epic: interest-form
Semver: patch

https://claude.ai/code/session_018JkxSHN3SsV57HYmUB2kSs
commits.title: resolve mobile Chrome CORS/SW fetch failures

commits.subject: fix(interest-form): add retry logic and mobile resilience for fetch failures
commits.body:
Debug report from mobile Chrome Android showed TypeError: Failed to fetch
after 628ms with API Reachable diagnostic also failing. Root cause is
likely transient mobile network failure or CORS preflight rejection.

Changes:
- Add single retry with 1.5s backoff for network-level TypeErrors
- Add navigator.onLine pre-check before attempting fetch
- Set explicit mode: 'cors' on fetch for mobile browser compat
- Add navigateFallbackDenylist to Workbox config to prevent service
  worker from interfering with cross-origin API requests
- Differentiate error messages: offline, connection dropped, server
  unreachable (with actionable guidance for each)
- Log attempt numbers and retry state in debug events

Tags: interest-form, mobile, fetch, retry, service-worker, cors
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: interest-form
Semver: patch

https://claude.ai/code/session_01RRKyPScNsjNwNpZbZKeymn
commits.title: add retry logic and mobile resilience for fetch failures

commits.subject: fix(lint): move setState out of useEffect in DebugBanner
commits.body:
The react-hooks/set-state-in-effect rule (eslint-plugin-react-hooks v7)
flagged runDiagnostics() being called inside useEffect because it calls
setDiagnostics (setState) synchronously within the effect body.

Moved the diagnostics trigger from the useEffect into the expand button's
onClick handler, which is the only call site for setExpanded(true). This
preserves the same behavior (diagnostics run on first expand) while
satisfying the lint rule.

Tags: lint, react-hooks, eslint, ci
Complexity: 1
Urgency: 4
Impact: infrastructure
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: ci-pipeline
Semver: patch

commits.subject: feat(debug): add floating debug banner with diagnostics and event log
commits.body:
Replace the single-button EmailDebugModal with a proper debug system
modeled after PWADebugBanner from another project. The system has three
parts:

1. debugLog utility (src/utils/debugLog.ts) — pub/sub in-memory event
   store capped at 200 entries. Global singleton so logs survive
   component re-renders. Any module can call debugLog() to emit events.

2. DebugBanner component (src/components/DebugBanner.tsx) — floating
   pill on the bottom-right that expands to a two-tab panel:
   - Diagnostics tab: runs health checks (HTTPS, network, API URL
     config, API reachability, service worker, install state, user agent)
   - Event Log tab: real-time color-coded entries from InterestForm
     (info=gray, success=green, warn=amber, error=red) with expandable
     details and source labels
   Controls: re-run diagnostics, clear log, copy-all-to-clipboard, close
   Clipboard fallback: shows selectable textarea if API fails on mobile

3. InterestForm integration — emits debugLog events at each lifecycle
   point: submit, request, response-ok, response-error, timeout,
   fetch-failed, api-url-missing, honeypot-triggered

Activated via ?debug=true URL parameter. Hidden from regular users.
The "Copy All" button produces a complete plain-text report (environment
+ full event log) formatted for pasting into another session.

Tags: debug, email, ux, mobile, diagnostics
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 2
Impact: internal
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: contact-form
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_01XRjc4wHALhzDUsSos5WjvP
commits.title: add floating debug banner with diagnostics and event log

commits.subject: refactor(debug): replace modal with one-tap copy debug report
commits.body:
The previous debug modal required opening a scrollable log, finding
entries, and copying them individually — too many steps on mobile.

Replaced with a single "Copy Debug Report" button that copies a
complete plain-text diagnostic report to clipboard in one tap.
The report includes environment (URL, user agent), API endpoint,
request summary, HTTP response (status, body, elapsed time), and
error details — formatted for pasting into another session to
diagnose email sending issues.

Fallback: if clipboard API fails on mobile, shows a pre-selected
textarea for manual copy.

Tags: debug, email, ux, mobile
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 2
Impact: internal
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: contact-form
Semver: patch

commits.subject: fix(quality): comprehensive code review improvements across codebase
commits.body:
Fix metadata mismatch (index.html had "John Doe" instead of actual name),
memory leak in usePWAUpdate.ts (setInterval without cleanup), array index
React keys in 6 components, missing fetch timeout in InterestForm, and
several accessibility gaps.

Added Vitest test suite with 42 tests covering API payload validation,
email regex, browser detection, and CV data integrity. Improved API
security with explicit CORS origin rejection and stricter email validation.
Enhanced UX with error auto-dismiss, UpdatePrompt error handling, and
proper ARIA attributes. Added lint step to CI/CD pipeline.

Tags: quality, testing, accessibility, security, ux, ci

Risk: low
Debt: paid

commits.subject: refactor(api): restructure from standalone server to Vercel serverless functions
commits.body:
Replaced the standalone Node.js HTTP server with Vercel-compatible
serverless functions. The API can now be deployed to Vercel with
`vercel --prod` from the api/ directory.

Key changes:
- api/api/send-interest.ts: Vercel serverless function for email sending
- api/api/health.ts: Health check endpoint
- api/vercel.json: Vercel build configuration
- Removed in-memory rate limiting (doesn't persist across serverless
  invocations) — CORS + honeypot + Vercel DDoS protection is sufficient
  for a personal CV site
- Updated docs with Vercel deployment instructions

Tags: refactor, api, vercel, serverless, deployment
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 2
Impact: infrastructure
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: email-interest-notification
Semver: minor

commits.subject: feat(contact): add interest notification form with SMTP email API
commits.body:
Allow visitors to send a one-off "I'm interested" message directly from
the CV site. The frontend form (InterestForm component) POSTs to a
configurable API endpoint. A standalone Node.js server in api/ validates
input, applies rate limiting, and delivers the email via the user's own
SMTP server.

Frontend: InterestForm with name, email, optional message, honeypot spam
protection, and loading/success/error states. Hidden when printing.
Degrades gracefully when VITE_INTEREST_API_URL is not configured.

Backend: Pure Node.js HTTP server with nodemailer. CORS-protected,
input-validated, rate-limited (5/hr/IP). Deployable anywhere — VPS,
Docker, or any serverless platform.

Tags: feature, contact, email, smtp, form, api
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: neutral
Epic: email-interest-notification
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_014ZbSF8aTapJ8iUUt3fVJJX

commits.subject: feat: create CV PWA with React, Vite, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS
commits.body:
Set up a complete Progressive Web App for displaying a personal CV/resume:
- React + TypeScript + Vite scaffold with Tailwind CSS v4 dark theme
- PWA support via vite-plugin-pwa (service worker, manifest, offline caching)
- 7 CV sections: Hero, About, Experience, Education, Skills, Projects, Contact
- Centralized CV data in src/data/cv-data.ts for easy content updates
- GitHub Actions workflow for automated deployment to GitHub Pages
- Print-friendly styles with white background override
- Responsive design with mobile-first approach
